intro: Microlicia nervulosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a small shrub characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves with prominent, parallel veins. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
